intro: Geum pyrenaicum f. robustius, commonly known as the robust mountain avens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its basal leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high elevations. It is a perennial herb that forms a low-growing rosette with thick, fleshy leaves. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
